cooking.name: Cooking Pot
comment: Reduces the amount of time required to cook any food or drink on a fire.
Allows the player to melt snow and boil water on a fire.
Allows player to cook Food and Drinks
Allows the player to create (Pot) Cooking Recipes

cooking.name: Cooking Skillet
comment: Allows the player to create (Skillet) Cooking Recipes
Allows player to cook Food and Drinks

cooking.name: Recycled Can
comment: Allows the player to melt snow and boil water on a fire.
Allows player to cook Drinks

cooking.name: Insulated Flask
comment: Can store and transport multiple drinks inside, keeping them warm
Comes in 6 fun design patterns!

cooking.name: Can Opener
comment: Used to open food cans without losing food/damaging can
Repaired with scrap metal

lighting.name: Flare
comment: Can keep Wolf at bay.
Lasts longer than the Marine flare.

lighting.name: Flashlight
comment: Can keep predators at bay during Aurora or Glimmer Fog.
Usable only during Aurora or Glimmer Fog.

lighting.name: Miner's Flashlight
comment: Can keep predators at bay during Aurora or Glimmer Fog.
Usable only during Aurora or Glimmer Fog.
Bigger battery, but Heavier than standard variant

lighting.name: Marine Flare
comment: Can keep Wolf and Timberwolf at bay.
Lasts shorter than the regular Flare.

lighting.name: Storm Lantern
comment: You can refuel it with lantern fuel or kerosene.
Can hold up to 1L of fuel
Weighs 1.80 kg when full

lighting.name: Spelunker's Lantern
comment: You can refuel it with lantern fuel or kerosene.
Can hold up to 1L of fuel
Weighs 1.80 kg when full
Uses 40% less fuel, but light is 40% dimmer than regular variant

lighting.name: Torch
comment: Can keep Wolf at bay.
Can be obtained with a lit fire.

lighting.name: Cardboard Matches/Wood Matches
comment: Very limited light source time. Only practical when used indoors

lighting.name: Wood Matches
comment: Very limited light source time. Only practical when used indoors

fire-starting.name: Accelerant
comment: Greatly increases the chance of starting fires
Only used to start fires

fire-starting.name: Can of Gunpowder
comment: Can be used to craft Ammunition
Can be used to greatly increase chances of starting fires
5 uses to start fires

fire-starting.name: Cardboard Matches
comment: More common than wood matches
Less useful at starting fires than wood matches
Can be used as a light source

fire-starting.name: Firestriker
comment: Most effective fire starter
Cannot be repaired and is very rare

fire-starting.name: Flare
comment: Cannot turn off after activating. Limited Fire-starting capability

fire-starting.name: Jerry Can
comment: 0.30L can be used as accelerant
Can hold up to 4L of fuel
Collects fuel from scrapped lanterns

fire-starting.name: Lantern Fuel
comment: Can be used to fuel Lanterns
Can hold up to 0.5L of fuel
Can be obtained from cooking fish
Can be used to greatly increase the chances of starting fires (requires 0.30 L)

fire-starting.name: Magnifying Lens
comment: Doesn't lose condition when used
Can only be used outside in clear weather

fire-starting.name: Marine Flare
comment: Cannot turn off after activating. Limited Fire-starting capability

fire-starting.name: Torch
comment: Can be pulled from fires and used to start a fire elsewhere (Daisy Chaining)
Must use a match if unlit in order to start a fire

fire-starting.name: Wood Matches
comment: Less common than Cardboard Matches
Increases chance of starting fires
Can be used as a light source

fishing.name: Fishing Bait
comment: Can be used to increase Ice Fishing odds

fishing.name: Fishing Lure (Acorns)
comment: Can be used to increase Ice Fishing odds
Better than Simple Fishing Lure

fishing.name: Fishing Lure (Wire Bundle)
comment: Can be used to increase Ice Fishing odds
Better than Simple Fishing Lure

fishing.name: Fishing Lure (Revolver Shell Casing)
comment: Can be used to increase Ice Fishing odds
Better than Simple Fishing Lure

fishing.name: Simple Fishing Lure
comment: Can be used to increase Ice Fishing odds

fishing.name: Fishing Tackle
comment: Required for fishing at ice holes
Can be used to repair clothing

fishing.name: Fishing Tip-Up
comment: Trap used to catch fish over time
Breaks after multiple uses

fishing.name: Hook
comment: Required to craft Fishing Tackle
Crafted using 1 Scrap Metal

fishing.name: Line
comment: Required to craft Fishing Tackle
Crafted using 1 Cured Gut

hand-tools.name: Hatchet
comment: Used to break down furniture and tree limbs
Can be used in a Wolf Struggle
Can be used to harvest and craft

hand-tools.name: Improvised Hatchet
comment: Crafted in the Forge
Works slower than manufactured Hatchets

hand-tools.name: Hunting Knife
comment: Used to break down cloth and cardboard items
Can be used in a Struggle
Can be used to harvest and craft

hand-tools.name: Improvised Knife
comment: Crafted in the Forge
Slower than manufactured knives

hand-tools.name: Cougar Claw Knife
comment: Crafted in the Forge
Does the highest damage during a Struggle
Requires killing a Cougar for materials

hand-tools.name: Hacksaw
comment: Used to break down metal furniture
Can break down tree limbs and harvest saplings

hand-tools.name: Heavy Hammer
comment: Used to craft tools in a Forge
Can be used to break down furniture

hand-tools.name: Prybar
comment: Used to open locked doors and cars
Cannot be repaired

hunting.name: Distress Pistol
comment: Rarest firearm in the game
Offers the best bleed out time of all weapons
Shots can scare off bears and wolves

hunting.name: Fishing Tip-Up
comment: Trap used to catch fish over time
Breaks after multiple uses
Must be tended to more frequently than a Snare

hunting.name: Flare Shell
comment: Used in the Distress Pistol
Very rare and difficult to find

hunting.name: Hunting Rifle
comment: Most powerful firearm in the game
Holds 10 rounds
Very slow and can only be fired while aiming

hunting.name: Barb's Rifle
comment: Most powerful firearm in the game
Heaviest Hunting Rifle
Highest durability of any Hunting Rifle

hunting.name: Curator's Rifle
comment: Most powerful firearm in the game
Farthest range of any Hunting Rifle

hunting.name: Vaughn's Rifle
comment: Most powerful firearm in the game
Lowest durability Hunting Rifle
Lightest Hunting Rifle

hunting.name: Rifle Ammunition
comment: Can be crafted at an Ammunition Workbench
Used in the Hunting Rifle

hunting.name: Revolver
comment: Holds fewer rounds than the Hunting Rifle (6 rounds)
Defensive over Offensive firearm
Faster draw speed than hunting rifle

hunting.name: Forester's Revolver
comment: Highest durability of any Revolver

hunting.name: Hunter's Revolver
comment: Heaviest Revolver
Farthest range of any Revolver

hunting.name: Warden's Revolver
comment: Lightest Revolver
Fastest draw speed of any Revolver

hunting.name: Revolver Ammunition
comment: Can be crafted at an Ammunition Workbench
More common than most ammunition
Used in the Revolver

hunting.name: Survival Bow
comment: The only ranged weapon that can be crafted
Ammunition is reusable
Cannot be Repaired

hunting.name: Woodwright's Bow
comment: Heaviest Bow
Highest durability Bow
Less sway and but also least range of any Bow
Ammunition is reusable
Cannot be Repaired

hunting.name: Sport Bow
comment: Lightest Bow
Same stats as Survival Bow, but more durable
Ammunition is reusable
Cannot be Repaired

hunting.name: Simple Arrow
comment: Can be crafted at a workbench
Harder to acquire resources to produce
Breaks after many shots
Can ricochet off of hard surfaces
Best durability arrow

hunting.name: Fire Hardened Arrow
comment: Improvised Arrow that can be made at Campfires
Easier to manufacture than Simple Arrows due to cheaper materials
Breaks after many shots
Can ricochet off of hard surfaces
Less durable than Simple Arrows

hunting.name: Snare
comment: Crafted at a workbench with 1 Cured Gut and 1 Reclaimed Wood
Used to catch rabbits over time
Breaks after multiple uses

hunting.name: Stone
comment: Most common ranged weapon
Used to stun rabbits and ptarmigans
Can be used to build rock caches

repair.name: Sewing Kit
comment: Allows players to repair damaged clothing or craft new clothing with the appropriate materials.

repair.name: Fishing Tackle
comment: Allows players to repair damaged clothing or craft new clothing with the appropriate materials.

repair.name: Firearm Cleaning Kit
comment: Allows players to repair damaged hunting rifle and revolver.

repair.name: Whetstone
comment: Allows players to repair damaged bladed tools.

repair.name: Simple Tools
comment: Allows players to repair a variety of damaged tools.

repair.name: Quality Tools
comment: Allows players to repair a variety of damaged tools at a better rate.

sleep.name: Bedroll
comment: Allows players to sleep.

sleep.name: Improvised Down Bedroll
comment: Allows players to sleep.
Improved version of the Bedroll.

sleep.name: Bear Skin Bedroll
comment: Allows players to sleep.
Can keep Wolf at bay.
Warmest, but also Heaviest, Bedroll

transmitter-parts.name: Handheld Shortwave Radio
comment: Used to find Supply Caches and hidden Bunkers in the Signal Void Tale
Requires a repaired Transmitter and the Aurora/Glimmer Fog to be present in order to pick up a signal

transmitter-parts.name: Wire Bundle
comment: 2 are needed to repair a Transmitter
1 bundle can be used to make a Fishing Lure (Wire Bundle)

transmitter-parts.name: Car Battery
comment: Heaviest item in the game, but 1 is needed to repair Transmitters
Can be broken down into Scrap Lead and turned into Bullets at an Ammunition Work Bench

transmitter-parts.name: Replacement Fuse
comment: 3 are needed to repair a Transmitter

other.name: Broken Arrow
comment: Can be harvested for 1 Arrowhead and 2 Crow Feathers

other.name: Broken Fire Hardened Arrow
comment: Can be harvested for 1 Crow Feather

other.name: Charcoal
comment: Allows players to map regions
Collected from burned out fires
Not available in story mode

other.name: Elevator Crank
comment: Used to operate the elevator in the Last Prospect mine

other.name: Gold Nugget
comment: A small clump of gold found in the Langston Mine.

other.name: Mountaineering Rope
comment: Allows players to Rope Climb in designated areas
Can create safer, faster shortcuts at the expense of Fatigue

other.name: Spray Paint
comment: Allows players to tag environments
Not available in story mode

other.name: Spray Paint - Glyph
comment: Can be used to distract, stop, or halve the fog of the Darkwalker

other.name: Travois
comment: Can be used to transport items anywhere on the Island

research-book.name: Stay on Target
comment: Can be Researched to raise the Archery Skill

comment: Can be Researched to raise the Ice Fishing Skill

research-book.name: A Sewing Primer
comment: Can be Researched to raise the Mending Skill

research-book.name: Frontier Shooting Guide
comment: Can be Researched to raise the Rifle Firearm Skill

research-book.name: Advanced Guns Guns Guns!
